Package space.sunqian.fs.io

Class IOKit

java.lang.Object
space.sunqian.fs.io.IOKit
public class IOKit extends Object
Utilities for IO related, some methods are provided by a default IOOperator.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    BUFFER_SIZE
    The default IO buffer size to use in this class: 1024 * 8 = 8192.

    write(@Nonnull Appendable dst, char @Nonnull [] src, int off, int len)
    Writes a specified length of data to the specified appender from the given array, starting at the specified offset.
    static void
    write(@Nonnull WritableByteChannel dst, byte @Nonnull [] src)
    Writes all data to the specified writable byte channel from the given array.
    static void
    write(@Nonnull WritableByteChannel dst, byte @Nonnull [] src, int off, int len)
    Writes a specified length of data to the specified writable byte channel from the given array, starting at the specified offset.
    static void
    write(@Nonnull WritableByteChannel dst, @Nonnull String str)
    Writes string to the specified writable byte channel with CharsKit.defaultCharset().
    static void
    write(@Nonnull WritableByteChannel dst, @Nonnull String str, @Nonnull Charset charset)
    Writes string to the specified writable byte channel with the specified charset.
    static void
    write(@Nonnull WritableByteChannel dst, @Nonnull ByteBuffer src)
    Writes all data to the specified writable byte channel from the given ByteBuffer.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • BUFFER_SIZE

      public static final int BUFFER_SIZE
      The default IO buffer size to use in this class: 1024 * 8 = 8192. And it is also the recommended IO buffer size.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • bufferSize

      public static int bufferSize()
      Returns the recommended IO buffer size, typically is 1024 * 8 = 8192.
      Returns:
      the recommended IO buffer size

    • read

      public static byte @Nullable [] read(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from the input stream into a new array, continuing until reaches the end of the input stream, and returns the array.

      If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      public static byte @Nullable [] read(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into a new array, and returns the array. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty array without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the input stream.

      If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns null.

      Note this method will allocate a new array with the specified length, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      @Nullable public static @Nullable ByteBuffer read(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from the source channel into a new buffer, continuing until reaches the end of the source channel, and returns the buffer. The new buffer's position is 0 and limit equals its capacity.

      If reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the source channel
      Returns:
      a new buffer containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      @Nullable public static @Nullable ByteBuffer read(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the source channel into a new buffer, and returns the buffer. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty buffer without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the source channel. The new buffer's position is 0 and limit equals its capacity.

      If reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns null.

      Note this method will allocate a new array with the specified length, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

    • readTo

      public static int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the input stream into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the stream or buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • string

      @Nullable public static @Nullable String string(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src, @Nonnull @Nonnull Charset charset) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from the channel as a string with the specified charset, continuing until reaches the end of the channel, and returns the string.

      If reaches the end of the channel and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the channel
      charset - the specified charset
      Returns:
      a string with the specified charset, or null if reaches the end of the channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      public static long readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst, long len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the appender, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the reader, returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      dst - the appender

      Returns:

      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal

      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the reader, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the destination array

      Returns:

      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds

    • readTo

      public static int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the reader into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the reader or buffer, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      public static int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the reader or buffer, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      public static byte @Nullable [] available(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the input stream into a new array, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the array.

      If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      public static byte @Nullable [] available(@Nonnull @Nonnull InputStream src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the input stream into a new array, and returns the array. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty array without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available.

      If reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read, returns null.

      Note this method will allocate a new array with the specified length, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

      Parameters:
      src - the input stream
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the input stream and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      @Nullable public static @Nullable ByteBuffer available(@Nonnull @Nonnull ReadableByteChannel src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the source channel into a new buffer, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the buffer. The new buffer's position is 0 and limit equals its capacity.

      If reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the source channel
      Returns:
      a new buffer containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      Reads a specified length of data from the source channel into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source channel
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the source channel and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      public static char @Nullable [] available(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the reader, continuing until no data is immediately available, and returns the string.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      public static char @Nullable [] available(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader, and returns the string. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty string without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available.

      If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns null.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, possibly empty, or null if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      public static int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, char @Nonnull [] dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from the reader into the destination array, until the read number reaches the array's length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the array's length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader

      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      public static int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, char @Nonnull [] dst, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the reader into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      src - the reader
      dst - the destination array
      off - the specified offset of the array
      len - the specified length to read
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of the reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull InputStream newInputStream(byte @Nonnull [] array)
      Wraps the given array as a new InputStream.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: supported and size-unlimited;
      • close: invoking has no effect;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      array - the given array
      Returns:
      the given array as a new InputStream

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull InputStream newInputStream(@Nonnull @Nonnull RandomAccessFile raf, long off) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Wraps the given random access file, starting at the specified file pointer offset, as a new InputStream.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: supports via RandomAccessFile.seek(long);
      • close: closes the random access file;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      raf - the given random access file
      off - the specified file pointer offset
      Returns:
      the given random access file as a new InputStream
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the offset is negative
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      the given appender as a new InputStream

    • newOutputStream

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull OutputStream newOutputStream(@Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable appender, @Nonnull @Nonnull Charset charset)
      Wraps the given appender as a new OutputStream with the specified charset.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • capacity:determined by the appender;
      • close: closes the appender;
      • flush: flushes the appender;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      appender - the given appender
      charset - the specified charset
      Returns:
      the given appender as a new OutputStream

    • limitedOutputStream

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull OutputStream limitedOutputStream(@Nonnull @Nonnull OutputStream stream, long limit) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Wraps the given stream as a new OutputStream of which writable number is limited to the specified limit.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • capacity: based on the given stream and limited by the specified limit;
      • close: closes the given stream;
      • flush: flushes the given stream;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      stream - the given stream
      limit - the specified limit, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the given stream as a new OutputStream of which writable number is limited to the specified limit
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the limit argument is negative

    • nullOutputStream

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull OutputStream nullOutputStream()
      Returns a singleton OutputStream which supports writing infinitely data but immediately discards them.
      Returns:
      a singleton OutputStream which supports writing infinitely data but immediately discards them.

    • newWriter

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull Writer newWriter(char @Nonnull [] array)
      Wraps the given array as a new Writer.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • capacity: in bounds of the array;
      • close: invoking has no effect;
      • flush: invoking has no effect;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      array - the given array
      Returns:
      the given array as a new Writer

    • newWriter

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull Writer newWriter(char @Nonnull [] array, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Wraps a specified length of data from the given array, starting at the specified offset, as a new Writer.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • capacity: in specified bounds of the array;
      • close: invoking has no effect;
      • flush: invoking has no effect;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      array - the given array
      off - the specified offset
      len - the specified length
      Returns:
      the given array as a new Writer
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the bounds arguments are out of bounds

    • newWriter

      The result's support is as follows:

      • capacity: in bounds of the buffer;
      • close: invoking has no effect;
      • flush: invoking has no effect;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the given buffer as a new Writer

      • close: closes the stream;

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull Writer limitedWriter(@Nonnull @Nonnull Writer writer, long limit) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Wraps the given writer as a new Writer of which writable number is limited to the specified limit.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • capacity: based on the given writer and limited by the specified limit;
      • close: closes the given writer;
      • flush: flushes the given writer;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      writer - the given writer
      limit - the specified limit, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the given writer as a new Writer of which writable number is limited to the specified limit
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the limit argument is negative
